description.en: Learn to use 'look + adjective' for visible appearance, 'seem + adjective' for abstract impressions, and 'sound + adjective' for auditory impressions. Master 'How does that look/sound?' for asking opinions.
description.es: Aprende a usar 'look + adjetivo' para apariencia visible, 'seem + adjetivo' para impresiones abstractas, y 'sound + adjetivo' para impresiones auditivas. Domina 'How does that look/sound?' para pedir opiniones.

tip.en: Use 'look + adjective' for visible appearance - what you can see with your eyes. 'Look' is for things that are visually apparent.
tip.es: Usa 'look + adjetivo' para apariencia visible - lo que puedes ver con los ojos. 'Look' es para cosas visualmente aparentes.

prompt.es: Parecía interesada pero no estoy seguro.

exercises.solution: She seemed interested but I'm not sure.

tip.en: 'Seem + adjective' is for abstract impressions or superficial opinions without clear evidence. More subjective than 'look'.
tip.es: 'Seem + adjetivo' es para impresiones abstractas u opiniones superficiales sin evidencia clara. Más subjetivo que 'look'.

tip.en: Use 'How does that look/sound?' when asking for someone's opinion about something visible or audible. Start with 'How' for opinion questions.
tip.es: Usa 'How does that look/sound?' al pedir la opinión de alguien sobre algo visible o audible. Empieza con 'How' para preguntas de opinión.

tip.en: 'Sound + adjective' is for auditory impressions - things you hear (like phone conversations, ideas explained verbally, etc.).
tip.es: 'Sound + adjetivo' es para impresiones auditivas - cosas que escuchas (como conversaciones telefónicas, ideas explicadas verbalmente, etc.).
